section.title: <drools:resource>'s parameters as nested elements:
section.para: When configuring a decision table resource you can nest a <drools:decisiontable-conf> tag to configure the resource.

row.entry: Decision Table input type: XLS or CSV
The worksheet name to be used in the when using an XLS
Bean's id is the name to be referenced from other beans.

section.title: <drools:kbase>'s parameters as nested elements:
section.para: There are two ways to define the a resource inside a kbase. You can nest a drools:resource, or you can reference a previously defined resource using drools:resource-ref. Additionally, you can configure schema models that would be compiled to types inside the kbase using <drools:model >.

example.title: kbase definition example
example.programlisting: <drools:kbase id="kbase1" node="node1"> <drools:resource source="classpath:org/drools/spring/IntegrationExampleTest.xls" type="DTABLE"> <drools:decisiontable-conf input-type="XLS" worksheet-name="Table_2" /> </drools:resource> <drools:resource-ref id="resource1"/> <drools:model source="classpath:org/drools/container/spring/model.xsd" /> </drools:kbase>
